Detailed Description

Class RamDataSink implements a data sink which writes to memory via a temporary RAM-file. These temporary RAM files are held in a temporary directory called _RAM_DATA_SINK on the RAM storage device. The names of the temporary RAM files are based on the string _ram_file_ appended with a unique ID.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

RamDataSink::RamDataSink (  UINT32  initial_size = 0,
DrmLocalId  id = c_drm_invalid_local_id
) 
 

Creates a RAM data sink instance. This data sink writes to an internally controlled temporary RAM file. The RAM data sink has to be opened using method Open() before writing to it. On destruction, the RAM data sink will be closed if not explicitly done before.

Parameters:
initial_size Defines the initial size of the RAM data sink.
id The DRM local ID.

RamDataSink::~RamDataSink (   )  [virtual]
 

Destroys the RAM data sink. On destruction of the last instance the temporary directory called _RAM_DATA_SINK is removed again.

Member Function Documentation

BOOLEAN RamDataSink::Save (  const Path &  file_path,
UINT32  copy_buf_size = File::c_copy_buf_size
)  const
 

Saves the contents of the RAM data sink to a file at file_path. It actually copies the internally controlled temporary RAM file to the specified file_path. Note that the RAM data sink has to be closed before it can be saved, otherwise an assertion holds. In addition, file_path must not specify a directory, otherwise an assertion holds. If the file at file_path already exists the method fails.

Parameters:
file_path The path of the file where to save the contents of the RAM data sink to.
copy_buf_size The size of the internally used copy buffer. The size of this buffer significantly affects the performance of this operation.
Returns:
Success of operation.
